column1: Gryazovets (Russian: Гря́зовец) is a town and the administrative center of Gryazovetsky District in Vologda Oblast

column1: == History ==
The first mention of Gryazovets dates back to 1538
column2: when it was described as a settlement dependent on the Korniliyevo-Komelsky Monastery. The settlement was chartered on January 25
column4: when it became the seat of Gryazovetsky Uyezd of Vologda Viceroyalty. The viceroyalty was abolished in 1796 and its part which included Gryazovetsky Uyezd became Vologda Governorate.Throughout the 19th century
column5: the population of Gryazovets varied between two and three thousand
column6: most of whom were employed in agriculture. The most common industry was dyeing. In 1872
column7: the railway connecting Yaroslavl and Vologda was built
column8: and a railway station was open in Gryazovets
column9: facilitating the development of the trade.On August 7
column11: Gryazovetsky Uyezd was abolished and the territory was included into Vologodsky Uyezd. On July 15
column17: and Gryazovets became the administrative center of the newly established Gryazovetsky District.

column1: == Administrative and municipal status ==
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Gryazovets serves as the administrative center of Gryazovetsky District. As an administrative division
column3: it is incorporated within Gryazovetsky District as the town of district significance of Gryazovets.As a municipal division
column4: the town of district significance of Gryazovets
column5: together with the village of Pirogovo in Pertsevsky Selsoviet and the village of Svistunovo in Rostilovsky Selsoviet of Gryazovetsky District
column6: is incorporated within Gryazovetsky Municipal District as Gryazovetskoye Urban Settlement.

column1: == Economy ==
=== Industry ===
Gryazovets hosts timber industry and food industry enterprises.
=== Transportation ===
One of the principal highways in Russia
column4: passes near Gryazovets. There are also local roads
column5: with the bus traffic originating from Gryazovets.

column1: In Gryazovets
column2: there is a railway station on the railroad connecting Yaroslavl and Vologda.

column1: Gryazovets has a gas-pumping station. Here
column2: the Gryazovets–Vyborg gas pipeline branches off the main Northern Lights pipeline in the western direction.

column1: == Culture and recreation ==
Gryazovets contains fifty objects classified as cultural and historical heritage of local importance. Additionally
column2: the building of a high school is protected as a historical monument of federal significance. The center of the town of Gryazovets mainly preserved the historical buildings from the 19th century. Close to Gryazovets there are ruins of the Korniliyevo-Komelsky Monastery which was abolished in 1924.

column1: The only museum in Gryazovets is the Gryazovets District Museum.
